name: Crawfish Dip
author: tonetta
summary: This should serve 8 to 10, but I usually double the recipe because it goes quickly.  I'm always asked to make this for every gathering.  It's a family favorite.
ingredients: 1 (1 pound) loaf processed cheese food, cubed
salt and black pepper to taste
directions: Heat butter in a large pot over medium heat
Stir in green onions, and cook briefly
Add parsley and crawfish, and simmer about 7 minutes, stirring frequently
Stir in flour to coat crawfish
In a small bowl, mix together egg yolks and evaporated milk
Stir into crawfish, and reduce heat to medium-low
Gradually add cheese cubes, stirring continuously until the cheese has melted
Season with salt, pepper, and hot pepper sauce
Remove from heat, and bring to room temperature before serving
